TopicTitle: The Shapeways Black Friday Special is Here!

Articles.Content:
<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1ttpn8O"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/a4fd36b1ee3bc1be2095be1b7aa6651e/tumblr_inline_nfnuioYoz11rr2wit.jpg"/></a></p>

<p>The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span><strong><a class="profileLink" href="http://bit.ly/1ttpn8O" data-hovercard="/ajax/hovercard/page.php?id=288891469878">SHAPEWAYS</a></strong><span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span>Black Friday special is not to be missed!</p>

<p>From today through Sunday, get free shipping on all orders, $10 store credit from the marketplace (delivered via email by December 6th) and 20% off own models with the code DESIGN20 (one per customer).</p>

<p>If you’ve been looking to get a <a href="http://bit.ly/1ttpn8O"><strong>KSP 3D PRINT</strong></a>, now’s the time!</p>

I was hoping I could wait until you guys released the Colored Plastic 3D prints.

http://www.shapeways.com/materials/full-color-plastic

I mean really though, it was announced months ago yet we can still only get fragile, brittle, heavy, expensive sandstone.

I was hoping I could wait until you guys released the Colored Plastic 3D prints.

http://www.shapeways.com/materials/full-color-plastic

I mean really though, it was announced months ago yet we can still only get fragile, brittle, heavy, expensive sandstone.

They even describe it as `coarse and delicate` on the site.

I`ll pass until I can drop it without worrying.

I really really want one of these too.

They even describe it as `coarse and delicate` on the site.

I`ll pass until I can drop it without worrying.

I really really want one of these too.

Well, the plastic is still fragile enough to be broken by drop, if I'm not mistaken, it's just not as fragile. They describe the material as coarse, porous. I have a sandstone EVA Kerbal, He survived a drop from about 3 feet onto a soft rug.

Still haven't settled on a name for the little guy. Maybe Kirrim? Gregoly? idk.
Oh, so they are not so robust even when not made from sandstone. Might have a think then.

Oh, so they are not so robust even when not made from sandstone. Might have a think then.

Well, then again, they do have a bacon mobius strip. Here's the link, give it a look. http://www.shapeways.com/materials/full-color-plastic
Still pretty expensive, at least for non-collectors.

I was going to buy one of these for my brother for xmas... PERFECT time to have a sale!

well my internet service went down as I was trying to decide which Kerbal to get, and it JUST came back, and now the coupon has expired!

UGH!

EDIT: no, it hasn't expired, it just isn't working... hm.

OH OH OH... it's only for things YOU have designed!... bummer.

The Stargazing Kerbal is my favorite. The rest are nifty, yes, but there's something delightful about the idea of a Kerbal, helmet off and serving as a seat, while said Kerbal watches the night sky with a grin.

Can we get more Kerbals on EVA?
